title: Kunde 2014 Dunfillan Cuvée Red (Sonoma Valley)
description: An estate-grown blend of 55% Cabernet Sauvignon and 45% Syrah, this wine is soft, supple and offers lasting structure. Blackberry and black currant combine for a jammy entry that's both sanguine and mineral in tone.

title: La Conreria d'Scala Dei 2010 Iugiter Red (Priorat)
description: Well into its run, this still smells of oak, but also dried, earthy berry fruits and schisty dust. A dense, flush palate remains on the wild side and probably will stay there forever. Ripe mature berry and oak flavors finish with warmth and toughness. Drink through 2024.

title: Lingua Franca 2016 Estate Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: Juicy and tart with flavors of fresh-squeezed pomegranate and raspberries, this tangy effort carries an impression of lemon rind also. It may remind you, at least at this stage, of a particularly ripe cru Beaujolais. Drink now for its youthful zip, or cellar for another year or two to ameliorate those tongue-tickling acids.

title: Louis Roederer NV Brut Premier  (Champagne)
description: Roederer's nonvintage cuvée is ripe and bright. The acidity and clean white-fruit flavors show strongly, allied to a tangy texture. It is a little drier than previous bottlings, a product of the ripe fruit that needed less dosage. Drink now.

title: Mas 2014 Malbec (Mendoza)
description: While some might find this over the top and overdone, it has its strong points, namely mossy aromas of cassis and mocha. Don't expect much tension from this Malbec; the flavors are ultraripe and jammy. While the label says 14%, this seems riper and heavier than that.

title: Mastroberardino 2017 Neroametà Aglianico (Campania)
description: Made entirely with black grape Aglianico, this refreshing, savory white wine opens with aromas of perfumed blue flower, wild berry and orchard fruit. The bright, rounded palate doles out juicy strawberry, white peach and a hint of crushed stone alongside fresh acidity.

title: Meiomi 2016 Reserve Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Soft, supple and earthy, with robust tannin structure and ripeness, this wine impresses in its interwoven layers of baked rhubarb, strawberry and cranberry. It lives up to its reserve-level billing and finishes dry.

title: Migration 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Tannic and full bodied, this wine holds its weight and grip well. On the palate, it offers a dense expression of cherry cola, warm baking spices and toasted oak.

title: Planeta 2014 Menfi Sito dell'Ulmo Merlot (Sicilia)
description: Made entirely with Merlot, this has inviting aromas of black plum, cedar and bay leaf. The concentrated, savory palate doles out black currant jam, clove, vanilla and mocha alongside fine-grained tannins.

title: Planeta 2016 Nocera Red (Sicilia)
description: This vibrant, silky red offers aromas and flavors of strawberry, wild raspberry, blood orange and mineral. It's medium bodied and lithe, with a salty, sea breeze finish.

title: Planeta 2016 Noto Controdanza Red (Sicilia)
description: Made predominantly with Nero d'Avola with a touch of Merlot, this offers aromas of dark berry, baking spice and underbrush. The savory plate offers black currant jam, vanilla and a hint of green peppercorn accompanied by fine-grained tannins.

title: Prospect 772 2016 Black Tie Charlie Red (California)
description: This is a rich, tempting and full-bodied wine with enticing oak spices in the aroma, and tongue-drenching blackberry and boysenberry in the flavor. An extra dark color, moderate tannins and extreme ripeness all combine to amp up the experience.

title: Quinta da Plansel 2015 Plansel Selecta Reserva Red (Alentejano)
description: Aged in new wood, the wine has a smooth texture and rich tannins that give this warm wine its structure and concentration. Black fruits are given a freshening by the ripe acidity. It's a fine wine, ready to drink from 2019.

title: Rancho Sisquoc 2016 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: Stewed red plum, pepper, dried herbs and baked earth show on the nose of this bottling. The palate starts quite zesty in a snappy raspberry-jam flavor, lifted by a hint of white pepper and solid acidity.

title: Rock Wall 2016 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Thick dense layers of mocha and baked cherry pie accent a rounded, richly ripe and well-made varietal wine that's full bodied and memorably expressive.

title: Rutini 2015 Encuentro Malbec (Mendoza)
description: A concentrated nose includes aromas of blackberry, black plum, coconut and charred wood. A thick, almost syrupy palate is on the heavy and round side, while this tastes of ripe blackberry and cassis. A rich finish with peppery spice and fudge-like flavors is warming.

title: Sanguinhal 2014 Quinta do Sanguinhal Reserva Red (Obidos)
description: Powerfully dense, this is a firm, structured wine even after four years. It has the weight of wood-aged Castelão, Touriga Nacional and Aragonez behind the black-plum and licorice flavors. It could still age further, so drink this stylish wine from 2019.

title: Serge Dagueneau et Filles 2017 Le Centenaire  (Pouilly-sur-Loire)
description: This rare wine is made from old-vine Chasselas grapes that were in Pouilly before Sauvignon Blanc arrived. It has a refreshing, light character with white stone fruits, creamed apple and lively acidity. Drink now.

title: Sidecar 2016 Off the Wagon Red (Rogue Valley)
description: Produced and bottled by Aberrant Cellars, this Southern Oregon Bordeaux-style blend is made from 35% Carmenère, 30% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Cabernet Franc and 15% Malbec. Blackberry fruit, cola and light details of earth and wood are set in a well-structured, polished frame.

title: Soléna 2016 Zena Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: Black cherry fruit and barrel notes of dark chocolate come together in this medium-bodied vineyard selection. There's a thin streak of cola, and the tannins are annotated with a suggestion of Mediterranean herbs, often found in wines from this AVA. It spent 10 months in 63% new French oak.
